solution_line_template: At regular price, the polo shirts are {num_shirts} x ${regular_price_per_shirt} = $<<{num_shirts}*{regular_price_per_shirt}={total_regular_price}>>{total_regular_price}.

At {discount_percent_num}% off, he gets a discount of , ${total_regular_price} x {discount_percent_num}% = $<<{total_regular_price}*{discount_percent_num}*{percent_factor}={discount_amount}>>{discount_amount}.
With this discount, the polo shirts cost ${total_regular_price} - ${discount_amount} = $<<{total_regular_price}-{discount_amount}={final_cost}>>{final_cost}.
